alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Clay; Floyd; Knott; Knox; Laurel; Leslie; Magoffin; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 23 at 4:49AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Laurel, northern Knox, southeastern Owsley, Leslie, Perry, Knott, west central Floyd, Breathitt, southeastern Magoffin and Clay Counties through 530 AM EST... At 449 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Elkatawa to Teges to Herron to McHargue. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Jackson, Noctor, Whoopflarea, Quicksand, Portsmouth, Mistletoe, Smith Branch, Dumont, Inverness and Brutus around 455 AM EST. Sikes, Saul, Press, Wilstacy, Stevenson, Haginsville, Valjean, Panco, Dalesburg and Morris Fork around 500 AM EST. Buckhorn, Big Creek, Buckhorn Lake S.P., Lunah, Peabody, Bear Branch, Shoal, Enline, Camp Lewis and Marcum around 505 AM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Bobs Fork, Daisydell, Lambric, Mosley Bend, Ogle, Confluence, Krypton, Toulouse, Chavies, Decoy, Brightshade, Evanston, Thousandsticks, Hosea, Ice Cliff, Lipps, Lamont, Stinnett, Elmrock, Ned, Hazard, Hyden, Ashers Fork, Waldo, Ordway, Wendover, Vail, Dryhill, Dice, Roark, Bulan, Queendale, Wooton, Orchard, Gunlock, Pyramid, Skidmore, Smilax, Mid, Hindman, Estill, Martin, Vicco, Ritchie, Hueysville, Frew, Daley, Emmalena and Cordia. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 12 and 59. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky near mile marker 29. Kentucky Highway 80 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 10. Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County between mile markers 1 and 20. Kentucky Highway 80 in Perry County between mile markers 9 and 15. U.S. Highway 25 East in Laurel County between mile markers 1 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Clay; Floyd; Knott; Knox; Laurel; Leslie; Magoffin; Owsley; Perry
